business.headline: Sensex, Nifty snap 7-day winning streak, HUL falls 4% after Q4 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 315.06 points to 79,801.43 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 82.25 points to settle at 24,246.70.

India hits pause on Indus Waters Treaty: Could this dry up Pakistan's economy?India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT). The announcement was made by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday, a day after a deadly attack in Pahalgam killed several civilians.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Gold prices today: Check rates in metro cities. What to expect?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold was priced at Rs 95,893 per 10 grams at 10.30 am, which was a rise of Rs 1,171 from the last close.
ITR filing 2025: Last date, refund timeline and documents. All you need to knowYou can submit your ITR for the year of assessment 2025-26 once the online portal goes live.

Middle-class stuck in debt trap, says Marcellus Investment's Saurabh MukherjeaUsing data from the Reserve Bank of India, Mukherjea estimates that 5-10% of middle-class households are now stuck in a debt trap.

Want to share UPI with family? Check steps to use BHIM app's UPI CircleUPI Circle is a feature where the main UPI account holder or the primary user can authorise up to five trusted people, i.e., secondary users to make UPI payments using his account.
Gensol says no ED notice received by company, stock continues steep fallGensol share price: The stock fell 5% to hit the lower circuit limit and has fallen over 50% in the last 6 months.

HUL Q4 profit falls 4% to Rs 2,464 crore; announces Rs 24 final dividendThe FMCG major reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 2,464 crore for the March quarter, down 3.7% from Rs 2,558 crore in the same period last year.

Explained: Why Rallis India shares tumbled over 6% after Q4 resultsThe Tata Group company posted a wider net loss of Rs 32 crore for the quarter ended March 31, 2025, compared to Rs 22 crore in the same period last year.

Saving for daughter? Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana still offers high interest. Check ratesSukanya Samriddhi Yojana not only offers high interest but also tax-free returns, thus making it one of the safest savings options for families with a girl child.

UBS upgrades stance on Indian stock markets, but finds China 'more attractive'Despite India's promising fundamentals, China remains UBS's top pick among emerging markets (EM), thanks to cheaper valuations and a stronger risk-reward profile.

entertainment.headline: Dhanashree Verma to make her acting debut with dance-centric Telugu filmChoreographer Dhanashree Verma is set to make her acting debut with the Telugu film 'Akasam Daati Vastaava.' The upcoming dance-centric movie is backed by Dil Raju.

Composer Anirudh pauses Bengaluru concert ticket sales after Pahalgam attackComposer Anirudh Ravichander has halted the ticket sales of his Bengaluru concert in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack. He mentioned that the new date will be announced soon.

Demi Moore named World's Most Beautiful person of 2025Demi Moore, 'The Substance' actor, has been named the World's Most Beautiful person of 2025 by People Magazine. The 62-year-old Hollywood icon broke age norms as she appeared on the magazine's annual cover, reflecting on beauty, ageing, and self-acceptance.

After Vincy Aloshious, another actor accuses Shine Tom Chacko of indecent behaviourAfter Vincy Aloshious, actor Aparna John accused co-star Shine Tom Chacko of indecent behaviour. She said that his remarks were explicit with sexual connotations.

Fawad Khan's Abir Gulal won't be allowed to release in India: Government sourcesFawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's 'Abir Gulal' will not be allowed to release in India, according to government sources. The movie was slated for release in India on May 9.

Anjali Anand's mother was cynical about her film dreams: Nothing without contactsAnjali Anand reflects on her journey in the film industry, revealing her mother's initial scepticism about her career choice due to lack of connections.

Why Fawad Khan, Vaani Kapoor's Abir Gulaal under scanner? All about the controversyPakistani actor Fawad Khan's upcoming film 'Abir Gulaal' has faced public outrage amid the terror attack in Pahalgam, with calls to boycott its release. The movie is slated to hit the screens on May 9.

Ranbir Kapoor bas baap achha hai, don't know his acting: Rahul BhattRahul Bhatt, Alia Bhatt's step-brother, talked about her husband Ranbir Kapoor in an interview. He said he doesn't know much about his acting skills but respects him for the kind of father he is.

AR Rahman breaks silence on trolling after split: Even God gets reviewed, who am I?Singer and music composer AR Rahman finally broke his silence surrounding the online trolling following his separation announcement with wife Saira Banu.

Nani's fan pitches film script at event, actor's encouraging gesture wins heartAn ardent fan of Telugu actor Nani from Kerala pitched a film script to him at the Kochi event of his upcoming film, 'HIT 3'. The actor promised to read his synopsis and encouraged him to pursue cinema.

Jaat box office Day 14: Will Sunny Deol's film reach Rs 100 crore in 3rd weekend?With 'Phule' and 'Ground Zero' hitting the screens this weekend, Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' will be looking at slowly but eventually surpassing the benchmark of Rs 100 crore at the box office.

Monster mayhem meets midlife-crisis and comedy: Why Kaiju No 8 is not to be missedKaiju No 8 follows Kafka Hibino, a 32-year-old who aspires to join the Defence Force to fight Kaijus alongside his friend Mina, despite repeated failures. Watch the anime for its relatable protagonist, stylish action and seamless comedy.

Lyricist Manoj Muntashir's strong video message to PM Modi after terror attackLyricist Manoj Muntashir shared a video message to PM Modi while condemning the Pahalgam terror attack. He demanded strong action from the government in response to the brutality.

Firefly review: A light-hearted Kannada film depicting complexities of depressionReleased-Thu Apr 24, 2025Firefly movie review: This Kannada film is a quirky depiction of the various stages of depression, written and directed by Vamshi Krishna, who also stars as the lead in the film.

Fawad Khan, other Pakistani actors condemn Pahalgam attack, unite against terrorismPopular Pakistani actors like Mawra Hocane, Hania Amir and Fawad Khan, among others, expressed their anger and frustration at the Pahalgam attack, which claimed 26 innocent Indian lives. They shared posts on social media, highlighting that terrorism deserves a united fight beyond borders.

Allu Arjun attends family wedding with wife Sneha and daughter Arha. Pics, videoAllu Arjun sported his latest look at a family wedding in Hyderabad on Thursday. He was accompanied by wife Sneha Reddy and daughter, Allu Arha.
Rohit Shetty confirms Simmba, Sooryavanshi sequelsFilmmaker Rohit Shetty recently confirmed that both Ranveer Singh's 'Simmba' and Akshay Kumar's 'Sooryavanshi' will have sequels.

Anurag Kashyap, Imtiaz Ali's daughters were in Pahalgam before terror attackAnurag Kashyap and Imtiaz Ali's daughters, Aaliyah and Ida were in Pahalgam, two days before the terror attack that took the lives of 26 people.

Kesari 2 box office Day 6: Akshay Kumar's film nears Rs 50 crore before 2nd weekendWhile Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' has kept a decent face at the box office so far, it will be challenged by new releases in theatres from this weekend. There's also 'Jaat', which has not gone out of the race yet. Will 'Kesari 2' be able to rise amid chaos at the ticket window and find its way ahead?

general news.headline: Punishment beyond imagination for every terrorist, PM promises after J&K attackPM Modi said the terrorists and conspirators behind the April 22 Pahalgam attack will get punishment beyond their imagination as he sent a strong-worded message from Bihar's Madhubani.

Every drop is ours: Pak calls India's Indus treaty suspension water warfareAs part of its diplomatic retaliation after the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty. Pakistan has vowed to challenge the move legally.

Can India turn off Indus tap and leave Pakistan high and dry?The suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty by India is more of a pressure tactic on Pakistan to force it to rein in terror groups and stop infiltration. Here is why India can't stop Indus waters to Pakistan overnight.

Fawad Khan's Abir Gulal won't be allowed to release in India: Government sourcesFawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's 'Abir Gulal' will not be allowed to release in India, according to government sources. The movie was slated for release in India on May 9.

With rare switch to English, PM Modi ensures world gets his message on terrorPrime Minister Narendra Modi, who usually uses Hindi and Indian regional languages in his speeches, made a rare switch to English at a rally in Bihar to convey that the perpetrators of the Pahalgam attack won't be spared. His use of English was to ensure that the world didn't miss a word of India's resolve to fight Pakistan-sponsored terrorism.

Disturbing video of Pahalgam horror, terrorists round up tourists, shoot themIn the video, an individual can be seen capturing the exact moment when the terrorists surrounded the unsuspecting tourists and began firing at them. While the sounds of gunshots and the screams of tourists can be heard in the background, alarming shots of bodies lying around can also be seen.

Video: Navy warship conducts missile test in Arabian SeaThis achievement demonstrates the Indian Navy's growing prowess in indigenous warship design, development, and operations, and underscores the nation's commitment to self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

With visa move, India makes it near-impossible for Pakistanis to enterIndia's decision to close the Wagah-Attari border and cancel the SAARC visa exemption scheme (SVES) following the Pahalgam attack will severely choke avenues of entry for Pakistani citizens.

Maharashtra man escapes Pahalgam massacre, his namesake gets killedOn Tuesday afternoon, five to six terrorists opened fire on a group of tourists in the Baisaran meadow, which is around 5 kms from Pahalgam. The meadow - also known as 'mini Switzerland' - is accessible only by foot or by horseback. The Pahalgam carnage was one of the deadliest civilian attacks in the Kashmir Valley in recent years.

Danish Kaneria slams Pakistan PM's silence over Pahalgam terror attackFormer Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria has questioned his country's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's silence over the terror attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam.

Case against BJP IT cell for Rahul Gandhi post after Pahalgam attackAn FIR has been registered against the BJP IT Cell at the High Grounds Police Station in Bengaluru over a derogatory social media post targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

Live: J&K Police release posters of Pahalgam attack suspects with Rs 20 lakh bountyTerror Attack In Pahalgam Live Updates: The Centre will hold an all-party meeting today and will brief leaders on the Pahalgam terror attack and hear their views. The move comes two days after the Pahalgam attack where terrorists killed at least 26 people, mostly tourists, on Tuesday. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah are expected to brief the leaders, official sources said. Targeting Pakistan following the attack in Pahalgam, India on Wednesday downgraded diplomatic ties with it and announced a raft of measures, including expulsion of Pakistani military attaches, suspension of the Indus Water Treaty of 1960 and immediate shutting down of the Attari land-transit post.

I wasn't asked to, but I recited kalma: Assam professor's Pahalgam survival storyDebasish Bhattacharyya, who was in Pahalgam with his family when a group of tourists were attacked on April 22, said a terrorist approached him during the attack.

Our life incomplete without them: Pahalgam hawker who saved tourist after attackSajad Ahmad Bhat, the man who was seen rescuing the injured after the terrorist attack, said he and other locals rushed to the spot and made all efforts to help injured tourists.

Pak plans missile test, issues no-fly zone in Arabian sea after J&K terror attackImmediately after the Pahalgam incident, Pakistan placed its Air Force on alert, according to sources. Unusual aerial activity was observed, allegedly involving the flight of AWACS aircraft near the Indian border.

Tamil Nadu bans mayonnaise made from eggs for one year citing medical concernsThe Tamil Nadu government banned the sale of mayonnaise prepared from raw eggs for one year, highlighting unsafe preparation and storage, leading to medical concerns among people.

AR Rahman breaks silence on trolling after split: Even God gets reviewed, who am I?Singer and music composer AR Rahman finally broke his silence surrounding the online trolling following his separation announcement with wife Saira Banu.

Salty rogan josh, horse delay helped 39 cheat death in PahalgamA rogan josh meal too salty, a delay in the arrival of horses, and a plate of bhelpuri are what saved 41 tourists from the site where terrorists were carrying out a massacre in Pahalgam. After terrorists killed 26 people in Kashmir, stories are now emerging of how luck turned into unlikely shields for over 40 people.

The message of Pahalgam: 'Normalcy' and cross-border terror cannot co-existDespite talk of 'normalcy', Kashmir remains trapped in cycles of terror and fear. A fresh civilian massacre reminds us that true peace in the Valley still feels painfully out of reach.

This is wrong, had 45-day visa: Pakistani leaves India after Attari border closureWhen asked about the suspected Pakistani involvement in the Pahalgam attack, the man declined to draw conclusions. "Nobody can tell who orchestrated the attack," he said.
Two-wheeler segment moves towards pre-Covid high, robust show expected in FY26The electric models contributed over 6% to the two-wheeler wholesales in FY25, according to SIAM data.

Congress resolution slams Hindu targeting, flags security lapse in J&K attackAppealing for calm, the top Congress body attacked the Home Ministry and blamed the Centre for 'immense security failure' and 'intelligence lapses.' The CWC further claimed that the attack on tourists took place at a site where three-tier security arrangements have always been in place.

Soldier killed in gunfight with terrorists in Udhampur 2 days after Pahalgam attackA soldier was killed on Thursday after security forces established contact with terrorists hiding in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district, following which a gunfight broke out, according to the Army.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

sports.headline: If Arjun Tendulkar trains under Yuvraj, he will become next Gayle: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh recently said that Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun, has the potential to become the next Chris Gayle if he starts training under Yuvraj Singh.

Rohit Sharma's innings vs SRH had vision, stability and perfect timing: HaydenMatthew Hayden feels that Rohit Sharma's knock against SRH had vision stability and perfect timing as MI cruised to a thumping win on April 23. Rohit continued his fine run of form with another fifty.

Will Barton announces retirement after 11 years in NBAWill Barton, one of the most underrated players in recent NBA history and a staple in Denver Nuggets lore, officially announced his retirement from professional basketball on Wednesday, April 23, 2025.

Watch: Munro accuses Iftikhar of chucking, heated argument followsDrama ensued in the Pakistan Super League on Wednesday when Colin Munro accused Multan Sultan's Iftikhar Ahmad of chucking. Multan captain Mohammad Rizwan then confronted the batter for making accusations about his bowler.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
